Reviews.Title: “Had an absolute blast!”
Reviews.Author: Jwhitneydavis
Reviews.Content: During the Mechacon convention, my family stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn. It was an amazing experience. The staff was kind and very courteous, the room was clean and cozy, the home-baked chocolate chip cookies were delicious, and my kids were talking about coming back next year! Though I had booked another hotel earlier in the trip, we infinitely preferred this hotel and can highly rate it for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, Great Value, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: rocketsfan007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 2 nights in August because I got an incredible rate from a booking website. The hotel turned out to be an incredible value for the price we paid. The lobby and furnishings are very modern and classy, despite being billed as a 3 star hotel. The hotel provides free wired and wireless internet, free printing services and complimentary cookies and lemonade in the afternoon. My rate was originally booked as a king room, but upon check in the front desk was more than willing to switch us to a room with two queens instead. In fact every time we entered or exited the hotel we were greeted with a smile and someone asking if there was anything we needed. Our room was comfortable and came with the usual amenities, mini fridge, safe, ironing board, coffee maker, work desk, etc. The beds even have a mattress control that allows you to change the firmness of the mattress. A very nice and unexpected perk. The bathroom and shower were also spacious. My two complaints with the hotel would be the noise from the club next door and the exorbitant price for parking. The hotel seems to share its courtyard with Generations Hall and our room overlooked the courtyard. We could hear general chatter from people outside. Also, the hotel charges about $30 per day for parking. In my opinion this is too much to pay in the warehouse district of Nola. There is a parking garage across the street that only charges $20 for overnight parking and there are also plenty of meter spaces around for overnight parking as well. Overall I would highly recommend this Hilton Garden Inn and would certainly stay again on return trips to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Star T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean. The entrance was great and the staff was very nice. The room had a fridge, coffee maker, microwave and a great view of the club next door. The beds were clean and comfortable. i will definitely stay here again. Be sure to book on a travel site, the rate was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda_Henson_Sorrow
Reviews.Content: Well done convention hotel. Close to the Convention Center and next to a cute little park. But breakfast is NOT free, pretty pricey. Also near the WWII Museum. Valet Parking is expensive too - make sure you get a convention rate!

Reviews.Title: “Really open space, and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: 35805Anna
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to attend an AORN conference at the convention center. I was able to walk to the convention site, which was a real plus. Ultimately, I only switched to Omni Royal Crescent related to a difference in price point, but overall the atmosphere, the pool was very inviting. It does feel a little bit off the beaten path, but there is a beautiful park close by and restaurants down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jhswilson3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn while attending a conference. The hotel is about 1 mile from the French Quarter. It was away from the craziness of Bourbon Street, yet close enough to walk to the French Quarter. The rooms were very spacious and well appointed. The beds were very comfy. The hotel has a nice gym with lots of equipment. The hot tub and pool area was very nice, though the pool was a bit small. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Latinacowgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March for the New Orleans Rock n Roll 1/2 marathon. We had never been to New Orleans before. This hotel is very clean and the staff was very helpful. It is very convienent to everything we needed.The only problem was there was also a cheerleading convention in town. I just wish that the people would show some respect for the other guest rather than letting their kids run up and down the halls and be as noisy as possible. We walked everywhere durring the day and took a cab back to the hotel each night. This was sugested to us by the bell man for our safety. If I am ever in New Orleans again I will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the cost with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Michael3745
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with great staff. Sure, it's not as trendy as the W or International House. I would rather stay here, if I have car to get around. All the staff I interacted with were cheerful. Irma in housekeeping was more than happy to give me a few extra coffee packages for the morning. Kate at the front desk was quick to comp us a lunch, when the restaurant didn't open right on time. The rooms were clean and updated too, with everything you would expect from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “No Internet, no regrets”
Reviews.Author: Bulitlist
Reviews.Content: I have been a Hilton Honors Diamond member for many years and prefer Hilton Garden Inn for my business travel. At this location the internet was down all morning preventing me from getting any work done. I stopped by the front desk on my way out to explain my dissatisfaction with the situation. The General Manager caught up with me and apologized for the inconvenience and offered me 5,000 bonus points for my trouble saying they would show up in my account in the next couple off days. It's been almost two weeks since my stay and no points. I am less irritated by the lack of internet than the GM promising something and not delivering. There are lots of Hilton properties in New Orleans. Pick another one.

Reviews.Title: “Standard desirable hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: MQ007
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel because it was close to the convention centre and no other reason. If I were visiting NOLA, I would have selected one more centrally located - this was 2km from the French Quarter, so it was walkable, but in the heat of the day, the distance was noticeable. The pool was tiny and I only saw someone use it once in the five nights I was there. At the rate they were charging for the room, breakfast ought to have been included. The service delivered by staff was excellent, and they also have a useful business centre where I could queue a print job from my room then go downstairs and enter a PIN code to release it at my convenience. One quirk we noticed - we did not use the hotel mini bottles of shampoo / conditioner / etc but the maid gave us more each day so by the time we left, there were 16 mini bottles in a pile on the bench in the bathroom. Not inconvenient, just weird.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as you would think.....”
Reviews.Author: OTR22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton for business and found it to be below my expectation level. My guest room air conditioning was not able to adequately cool the room, and the bed was not very comfortable. I also found the $30 to park my car excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel a little away from the Craziness!”
Reviews.Author: Gene C
Reviews.Content: Basic Garden Inn that is across from Convention center. Can walk if weather is nice to FQ. IN Wharehouse District which is getting starting to get a facelift, nice apartments/lofts, bars, resturants. Found it a nice change from Canal St. Hotels near Burbon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HK0
Reviews.Content: Was here for a week for work. The location was good, but not ideal. Easy to walk to things, but not in the thick of it, whic I would prefer. The hotel itself was very nice, with friendly staff, tidy reception and pleasantly sized rooms. Parking was somewhat inconvenient, and the pool was a joke. The fitness center was rather modest as well. But there was a decent hot tub =) Overall, this was a fine hotel, and if you can get a good deal, I'd recommend it. One thing: if you get valet, it's very eensive and I recommend you double check your receipt- they massively overcharged me, but quickly fixed the error over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “A great property with outstanding staff and the best omelettes”
Reviews.Author: jackSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We travel for business and stay in three or four different hotels a month, mostly Hilton and Marriott. This is probably the best Hilton Garden Inn in which we have ever stayed. Certainly it is the best managed; Mr. Stackpole is doing an outstanding job. His staff is well trained, professional and friendly, and absolutely accommodating in all guests' needs/requests. We are gone from home for long periods and depend on hotels for services not usually needed by the average traveler. This hotel was on top of our every request - it was a pleasure to deal with the hotel staff. We had a suite which was very roomy; a refrigerator was included. There are many restaurants a short walk away, including the Corporation, a-funky-fun-price-is-right place just across the street. The convention center is a block away and the Quarter a 10-15 minute walk (take a cab to Coops). The Hilton corporation should send the lady who makes breakfast to all their hotels and teach the staff to make omelettes - the very best in any hotel in which we have stayed. Thank you Mr. Stackpole and your staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Trip, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flip f
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 6-14---6-16. I arrived late, check in was flawless. I booked a king suite. Our room was clean and very spacious. One great thing was that there were four bath towels and 5 face cloths. Very surprising. Most hotels you have to ask for more towels. The staff was excellent and answered all of our questions. The french quarter is north of this location. A nice walk of about 10 minutes. It is great because it gives you the lay of the area and you are not trampled by the crowd of people visiting the french quarter. A very quiet area which is nice. I felt the area is safe for families to visit without the worries of anything happening. The river walk mall is 3 blocks to the north. The entrance is very deceiving, you cross the street and it looks like cruise ship boarding but it is a mall entrance. There are a lot of food choices. The hotel is in the convention center area and is a short walk to the main entrance. I will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: dunder36
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay. Hotel is a short walk away from the French Quarter, which means that it is fairly quite at night, which is a positive. The staff is great. Rolita is as good as there is. You can tell she enjoys what she does and she wants people to enjoy their visit to New Orleans. We had a malfunction with our room the second night around 11:00pm, our AC was not cooling and the fire alarm in the room was not hooked up. We called the desk, and immediately Brian from engineering showed up and resolved both issues within a matter of minutes. These days customer service is often hard to find, but the staff at this Hilton Garden Inn believe in and will make your stay enjoyable. TIP: If you have trouble deciding on tours around the city. As Rolita to help. She fixed us up in a matter of minutes and made all the arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia94109
Reviews.Content: I came here on a business trip in February after a last minute debacle with the terrible Hotel New Orleans (see separate review under Hyatt Place New Orleans). It was great! The people at the front desk were very warm and welcoming. They even gave me a free bottle of water on Valentine's Day. The restaurant folks were also friendly and accommodating. The rooms were perfect for a business trip, complete with a super comfortable bed similar to the sleep number where you can change the setting to your own personal level of firmness. I don't think I've ever slept so well in a hotel room. The fitness center was clean and in good condition. I used it for 4 days straight. Very close to the convention center, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are attending a conference. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, service & business centre”
Reviews.Author: Michelle M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for anyone looking for a nice hotel in a great location of New Orleans. My husband I are stayed here in April for the French Quarter Festival and were very pleased with everything. The staff are very friendly and the rooms, lobby and hallways are sparkling clean. There was fresh coffee and tea in the lobby, as well as lemonade and cookies in the afternoon. The walk to the French Quarter is just over 10 minutes, and we felt very safe during this walk, even after midnight. If you want the walk to go a little faster, stop at PinkBerry at Canal and South Peters for a treat during the walk back. :) I must make note of the Business Centre, as well. It was a good sized room with 3 computers with free Internet access. Also had a photocopy machine, pens and paper, white-out, and everything you could think of. We recommend this hotel 100%, and will stay there if we ever go back to NOLA (I hope!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice service, love the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: doc8reg
Reviews.Content: Located in the warehouse district of New Orleans, this mid range full service hotel is appropriate for guest attending a convention. The service is good, the usual Hilton touch of little extras like drinks, hot oatmeal cookies in the lobby all added to the sincerity of the service. The rooms are well appointed, and comfortable. I had very nice sleep during my stay. And most of all i really appreciated the free wifi internet service up to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference a couple weeks ago during the French Quarter Festival. The hotel was quiet, clean, and the staff was very helpful & friendly. Hotel is a bit of a walk to the Riverwalk, Canal Street, and the French Quarter, but the weather was nice so walking wasn't an issue. On that note, food options (besides the hotel offerings) were a bit of a walk as well. Ended up having to share the room with another conference member since it was so expensive but the double queen bed room comfortably fit two people. I slept very comfortably on the beds, but a quick note - ask the staff how to run the firmness dial, because I never did figure out how to adjust it. Oh, and the free WiFi was a huge bonus - I was very appreciative of that, as the other places I have stayed at charge a daily fee for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Conventions”
Reviews.Author: Alice H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my companies national meeting. I was so happy we were just steps away from the convention center, esp with an early work schedule. The hotel was clean and staff friendly. The rooms had a microwave and a fridge which was a nice touch. The gym was small but had two treadmills and two eliptical machines. The chocolate chip cookies available each evening were perfect and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: susantodd
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter and I were in this hotel for four days in mid march. Everything was 100% tidy, quiet, friendly and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, time for a renovation”
Reviews.Author: james b
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here four nights for a convention at the nearby conference center. I'm in the business, so I have a critical eye for hotels. What's good: very nice staff, couldn't be nicer, from doormen to front desk to breakfast servers, all exceptionally warm and helpful. Even the maid introduced herself with a smile. What's fair: location. If you're here to use the convention center, its convenient. But other than that, its a long walk to the french quarter, hard to find taxis, and a long walk to the tram which is slow and loses its charm after the first run. What's weak: Time for a total renovation. It's not the housekeeper's fault, but the place looks tired and in need of a deep clean. Most of this is absence of attention to worn fabrics and furniture. Carpets are deadly, and air-conditioning systems are old and very noisy. Certainly not up to the usual Hilton standards. Would I stay there again? Probably not. There are many nicer hotels in this city, and until I see the word "totally renovated" I would chose another. Again, don't blame the staff. They are top notch. This is management issue.

Reviews.Title: “Southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SueandFrank
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in town, close to everything and very comfortable quiet rooms. The best part was the southern hospitality and genuine pride of their grand city. Especially outstanding is Michael in the front lobby who was there to great us, and recomended some places to see. We took his advice and did the city and cemetery tour.

Reviews.Title: “Right across the street from Cruise Terminal-clean & comfy”
Reviews.Author: McBizzle1
Reviews.Content: St Patty's Day Weekend stay...Wonderful newer Hilton Garden Inn in the Warehouse District right across the street from the cruise terminal. Lovely contemporary design, large lobby with an actual bar and restaurant! Our room was a typical 2-queen bedded room. Clean & comfy-smallish bathroom. Kids loved the pool! It's a 15 minute walk to Bourbon Street area-cabs were readily available. There are several great bars and eateries right down the street from the hotel (don't let the outside appearance put you off-the food in some of the "dive bars" is THE BEST!!). We were able to leave our vehicle at the hotel (valet parked) for the duration of our cruise. This hotel is close enough to the action but far enough away to escape the sights and sounds of NOLA when desired (especially if you're traveling with children). Front desk/valet/restaurant staff were warm, friendly, and most of all...helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton beware, this HGI loves it's guests”
Reviews.Author: 2tired2choose
Reviews.Content: Originally booked at another hotel, unable to get rooms here due to Final Four - the property made room for our staff. They did not want us burdened with the daily commute to the Airport Hilton. (Who does that?) This place bends over backwards and sideways for the guests. When inquired directions to walk in the evening, I got direction and personal cell phone numbers of staff in case I needed anything. I could go on. I might later, but here are the basics - They are staffed! You can always find one to help, no one is hiding :) Lovely, spacious comfortable rooms. I slept like a rock Away from Burboun street, but easy walk or $7.00ish cab ride. Within one block you can eat the best of New Orleans cooking Pool is privately located and roof-top. I loved it ! Great gym - plenty of cardio and weights. Safe location to go for a run out and about Make sure you ask the chef to cook you something here, they are creative, and have a passion for making you smile. Ask the staff anything, they will get it, find it, direct you to it .... I was beside myself with their attentiveness. Housekeeping is great! They are personable and helpful too. The staff knows the area well and will give you insider food and shopping info. The business center is standard HGI, everything you need I would recommend for family, friends, business etc. There is no doubt this is where I will stay when I come back. Lovely courtyard in the back that is comfortable and private to gather with friends. Have I mentioned I can't wait to come back to this place on vacation? I can't wait! All in all it is impressive. It was recently rennovated, so make sure you read "post rennovation" reviews

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel, Terrible Service, BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieHoustonTX
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night, always have had good luck with Hilton. This hotel is an example of how even a reputable chain can have a very bad apple. Room was dirty, especially the bathroom, hallways smell like mildew. Front desk rude and only interested in enetertaining each other. There is obviously an upper management problem with ths hotel- even when a guest complains as we did, there was no effort to make it better, i.e., offer a different room or havea maid service re-clean. There are many better choices in the area for $275 nite- this place is a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: RaveDJ
Reviews.Content: I consulted Google maps and found this hotel was a little outside "the centre of things" for Mardi Gras and (potentially) in an ominous area but it could not have been more perfect. Sure, it's quite a walk to the French Quarter and late at night, the route might seem to take you through some gloomy streets - the surrounding area is a little decrepit - but I found the hotel itself to be well-appointed and safe. It was certainly comfortable (luxurious for a 3 star), and was within striking distance of all central parade routes. The lobby restaurant serves an excellent (if over-priced) hot breakfast selection and the small courtyard at the back provides a quiet haven for smoking and chatting. We visited the Howlin' Wolf bar and the local restaurants (just down the street), and were quite happy to stroll to Bourbon Street and Canal Street (alternatively, taxis are right outside). The important things were that the room was cool and spacious, there was little noise even on the rowdy nights, and the beds were welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and unclean”
Reviews.Author: Tracey B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was $229 per night. The rooms were unclean(hair in tub and on toilet) and the hall carpet was stained.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Well Thought Out, Safe and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Dhoom13
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a convention and the location cannot be beat. Excellent value and great room/amenities. Was late for breakfast and the staff insisted I hang on and let them muster up something. That was very warm and welcoming. Bell man was awesome and front desk staff helped me track down my shuttle when it hadn't shown up. Basically its a not too many frills, simple but clean place to stay with very competent staff who are eager to help. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern beautiful room decor in recently renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: BRINCKLEY
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renovated recently and the rooms are one of the nicest and modern, luxurious rooms for a Garden Inn I have come across. The best perk I rarely see in rooms was central A/C!!! It took the humidity out so I could sleep well. Was a little concerned, as I was close to the elevator but fortunately the noise was low, although I did hear the soft "ding" whenever the door opened, so if you're a light sleeper request a room further down. Fortunately room doors don't slam shut! Halls do echo tho if people come back drunk and talking loud, which occurred throughout the night! My only gripe was that I checked in, exhausted, with 4 hours of sleep at 9am. The front staff told me I had to wait until 10:30 when the first room was available. I literally slept in the lobby, gave up around 10 and gave her my cell # to call me. I called them around 11am and another lady told me it was ready. Half hour later I get a VM from 1st lady the room was available.

Reviews.Title: “THIS WAS A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: I Stay at this hotels 4 weeks ago a week before the Mardi Gras. At first i was thinking what a very nice place a lil off the main drag which i liked, Very nice staff. Very nice rooms. This was until i discovered something missing from my room. There was some very expensive meds stolen from my room (250 an once) after this it all hit the fan not one wanted to take blame and i know it was not a mistake because i did not leave it out so someone had to open my draw to find it . After this they offered to replace it i can not be replace there. They offer my friend (he paid for the room) a night off . But they double charged him and said it would take more than a week to fix. I was never compensated and it was hell to fix the charges... I was never give a formal sorry from they GM nor was i told the out come of there investigation..(so called.. for the rest of my trip i would not allow any staff in my room thats just nasty ...Krama will see them soon so will the BBB... stay at it you like just watch your thing ...mantitan@yahoo.com if you want to comment me

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....but stay away from the pop machine!”
Reviews.Author: NopantsTom
Reviews.Content: I stayed during Mardi Gras and it was a great hotel. All of the staff I talked to were very friendly. Very clean hotel and the rooms were great. The area around the hotel looks rather sketchy but it isn't. It is about a 10 minute walk to Harrahs Casino and about a 20 minute to Bourbon street. If you are going to walk to Bourbon street I recommend wearing very comfortable shoes! I stayed on the second floor and went to the pop machine and if you want a bottle of iced tea then press the Sprite button, if you want Dr Pepper press the Iced tea button and if you want coke well forget it the machine is just going to eat your money. You can hear noise coming from outside not super loud but you can still hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Zozokat
Reviews.Content: Despite being a sold out Mardi Gras weekend, the staff was amazing! Kevin and Michael were so friendly and helpful. Front Desk staff and Dining Room staff were great. And our housekeeper (room 506 on 2/18-2/21/12) was awesome. Would go back any day! Thanks HGI-Nola Conv Ctr! :))

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: timaeus1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel a good distance away from the craziness of the French Quarter, but not too far. If it had been warmer outside we may have been able to walk from the hotel to Bourbon St, but it's a short cab ride otherwise. Staff were very friendly and helpful (something that surprised me since I experienced a lot of rudeness/bad customer service during my last visit to NOLA). Room was just a regular hotel room, nothing great, but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ladyinmaryland
Reviews.Content: We arrived after midnight and check-in set the tone for a very good stay. The hotel was recently renovated and is located in the Warehouse District. Our 3rd floor King Suite was very clean, comfortable and roomy. We were attending an event at the Convention Center which made this HGI a plus as we could see the convention center from our window, literally one short block away. The made-to-order breakfast offers the largest variety of items Iâ€™ve seen thus far in my stays at HGI properties. Breakfast is served until noon on weekends. While the variety was exceptional, the food on our first morning was not hot. My spinach, ham/cheese quiche and sausage patties were served warm. Breakfast on Saturday morning was great (Derek makes a perfect extra cheese omelet)! The wait staff was attentive as well as all the staff we encountered during our three night stay. Michael Weir was very helpful with transportation tips. The hotel has valet parking only at a cost of $30.00 per night. The hotel is 8-10 blocks from Canal Street but public transportation stops (bus, trolley) are a short walk nearby.

Reviews.Title: “First time to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tammyluree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! The staff was so very helpful with first timers getting around their city. Our valet guy Michael had an incredible sense of hospitality and was always Johnny on the spot when we needed something. The rooms were clean, comfortable (temperpedic beds) and full of everything that you would expect. A room facing east (as ours was) has no view, other than empty warehouses. But it was also nice and quiet. The bar is expensive about $25 for 2 drinks but they make very good drinks. The breakfast in the morning is $12.99 and was a little high but very good as well. The chefs are friendly and kind to explain what everything was. Over all this hotel was well worth the money. We were very pleased. And if you go...ask for Michael the valet guy...give him 30 or 40 dollars and he will take very good care of you with any of your needs for your entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: dramady
Reviews.Content: So, make sure, if you're not the party type (like we aren't) to make sure you're on the quiet side of the hotel, or you get the bar band from across the way until midnight. But the next morning, the staff very kindly and efficiently moved us to the other side and a better night's sleep was had for both of us! In fact, all staff we interacted with was friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet was tasty, too. The hotel was very close to the convention center, our reason for being there and walking to the French Quarter was entirely do-able.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PentaxPaul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week while attending a convention in New Orleans. It is very convenient to the convention center and about 6-8 blocks from the French Quarter. The room was large, clean, and the bathroom was spotless. It seems the hotel is relatively new, so everything worked well. There are not a lot of amenities, but is great for a business trip. Free internet, coffee in the morning was an added treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel (albeit a bit away from the French Quarter)!”
Reviews.Author: RoamingGnomette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property when we were down there for BCS National Championship Game in Jan. 2012. It was a nice hotel, but we got there on the Saturday night that the Saints were playing the first playoff game at home...big mistake! The hotel parking was full and we had to park down the street. It was very unorganized. (We were able to get hotel parking the next morning.) The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. The rooms were cozy but the beds not as much. They have the dial settings where you can change the firmness of each side of the bed and we could never find one that was comfortable. The resturant was good and the food was very yummy. There was a refrigerator and microwave in our room so we could store and reheat leftovers. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but being farther away from the French Quarter than we had hoped, we will probably not stay there again. It is great if you are in New Orleans for a convention since it is convenient to the convention center itself.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: JustPassingThrough76
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our cab and up to the front door, we were greeted by the "director of first impressions" who took our bags to our room, gave us brochures and offered to answer any questions regarding our stay. After that point, all our experiences were positive. All the staff were attentive and quite fast with any requests we had (new towels delivered within minutes to our room, maintenance man arrived at the pool door within minutes to help us with a locked door, room service delivered with a smile and very tasty!). The rooms were clean, bright, welcoming, comfortable. The shower was AWESOME! The alarm clock was easy to use. The TV was HUGE! Breakfast was very tasty! Front Desk always friendly and willing to go above and beyond. We also really appreciated the free coffee in the lobby in the morning! :-) Hot tub was HOT! Pool was nice and warm (we visited in January). FREE WIFI and we got a great rate of $169. We were conveniently located a block from the convention center and felt safe walking during the day and at night to and from the hotel. We did however, have to take a cab to the French Quarter as it was more than a mile away and didnt want to walk through the warehouse district at night, but since we were there for business, we only went 2 times so the cost was minimal. Its about $8 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: hrbreckenridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our trip. Great location, nice rooms, and friendly staff. I was very surprised by how thin the walls were. We could hear everything the people in the other room were saying! So be careful what you say or do in your room : )

Reviews.Title: “Great room,but required some walking”
Reviews.Author: Celleb
Reviews.Content: The rooms were recently remodeled and were great!In fact the friends that stayed with us said their room was nicer than the room that they had paid 3 times as much for at a more upscale French quarter hotel.It was closer to the convention center which put us farther from the quarters but we knew that and were prepared.Staff was helpful.Breakfast was great.Overall,a great experience.One warning-if you're coming to have a party,this might not be the place for you.We were visiting with friends and had a 3,4,8,and 11 year old with us.Someone called downstairs to report that the children were too loud,so apparently there's not much insulation between the rooms because by kid standards,they were not that loud and the neighboring room could hear them.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: mascontent
Reviews.Content: Thank you, the staff of Hilton Garden Inn at 1001 South Peters, you are the best! The hospitality that you displayed from entering the building is just addictive. I was there for my first visit to New Orleans meeting my husband who was attending conference, I felt like I was there meeting family also because of their hospitality. Although the hotel is under construction and the city has went through tremendous downfall; the staff did all within their power to make you like all was well with the world and no matter the situation the tenacity displayed was we are going to make it. The beauty of the French Quarter is breath taking. We will be back to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: HandsumMuscle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 3 nights. They were doing construction but it wasn't a problem. I liked my room a lot, very comfortable, huge flat screen tv, refrigerator and microwave and a nice side chair to relax in. I'd definetly stay again. The French Quarter is about a 15 minute walk. The front desk was super friendly. HW/3*

Reviews.Title: “great location - very clean, quiet, nice”
Reviews.Author: HawkMom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and felt very comfortable. The room was nice, has just been remodeled. Only problem was the new beds have an adjustable number on each side that lets the air go from one chamber to another to make it more comfortable. Once we figured out how it worked (change the number to soft or harder and lay on the bed for at least 15 minutes or longer to start to feel it change) - we got it set and had great sleep. There are 9 chambers in the bed and depending on the setting you pick - air moves back & forth in the chambers to contour to your body. Nothing plugs in to electricity - no motor or air pump runs these. New concept. Everyone was helpful. We took cabs several times to go to the French Quarter or French Market, for 2 of us it cost about $7.50 total + tip. My husband went for work to the convention center for an expo, while another spouse & I went shopping or sightseeing during the day. At night we found several good restaurants and bars to go sit and enjoy the area. Sat night went to Bourbon St and walked the length of it - was very crowded, rest of week it wasn't bad to walk at all, no big crowds. Ate breakfast in the hotel, one day went to a local cafe/dive called "Mothers" - best ham around.(Place is nothing special though!) Went to Dickie Brennan's Palace Cafe (on Canal St) for dinner - had Bananas Foster for dessert - great choice!!! Went to Embers another night. Went on the Natchez riverboat for a cruise - was interesting. The bartender at the hotel is a great guy - really enjoyed him. (Brian I think it was). Also, a nice little sports bar/grill down the street called Ernests, recommend it too.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthsideEddie
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Hotel is situated in the Warehouse district of New Orleans. The staff were very obliging and helpful. My room was comfortable. The are a lot of nice restaurants close to the Hotel and as it is a little distance from the French Quarter it is quiet. As other reviewers have noted it is close to the Convention Centre. I had an enjoyable stay in the Hotel and found it to be excellent value. Highly recommended The hotel is in the course of renovation but I was not inconvenienced by the work in any way

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: captjmmo8112
Reviews.Content: As a corporate pilot I stay in many many hotels and this Hilton is by far the worst one ever ! When I arrived a lady behind the desk at a computer told me "I'm to busy right now" and finally another lady showed up and checked us in, she wasn't much better with her attitude. The noise coming form the convention center was just awful its started about 6pm and lasted until 3am. I went to the front desk to see if I could change rooms and the same attitude with the front dest help.............they just didn't care about there're guests ! I will say the girls at the breakfast buffet were really nice and pleasant. I won't be staying at another Hilton for a long long time. Don't stay there folks you won't like it and the cost for a room is really high.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice.”
Reviews.Author: Jrf021
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights on a business trip. This place is clean, good service. They are currently in construction (renovations) until December 2011 or January 2012. You may need to check this. Parking is very expensive, but this is typical in all New Orleans Hotels. However, you may be lucky and park in front of the hotel. There are park meters, but parking is free after six (I think) and until 08:00 am. So if you arrive late from work and leave early, you may save a few bucks on parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: congdoc
Reviews.Content: Walkable to Harrahs, close to my favorite cajun restaurant Mulattes!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vineyboy657
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Expedia.co.uk and got a good weekend deal. On arrival i was greeted by a beaming smile from the receptionist and was dealt with swiftly. The room was good and i like the Hilton Garden Inn brand, so was not disappointed. What made this hotel a littel different though was the friendliness of the staff, who are obviously well motivated. Service i know is better in teh USA than the UK, but this was taken a degree further at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravlingTS
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed overnight for business. The hotel was nice,clean and front desk staff was very accomadating. The parking was ok - you do not need to valet as they have reduced pricing for self park. I was not crazy about the Warehouse district as I was not familar with the area. There is construction going on in the hotel which is a probelm if you want to rest in the afternoon. Love the cookies they leave out for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: RandBrad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Labor Day weekend, but due to the tropical storm I checked out 2-days early. The hotel staff was absolutely cooperative about the early check-out, and were wonderfully nice and helpful during my short stay. The hotel was undergoing a complete renovation, but this process was so well managed that it never impacted my stay one bit. Due to the weather, I never checked out the pool. And being a foodie in a foodie city, I didn't check out the hotel's restaurant. But the room was completely comfortable, the location was great for my purposes (I specifically wanted to be in the warehouse district for proximity to museums, galleries, restaurants, the streetcar and away from the hubbub of the French Quarter. The rate was excellent. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel for a quick overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Josh W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and friendly when my wife and I stayed in September 2010. We stayed one night, because the next day we were going to board our cruise ship at the port. The hotel is situated kitty-corner from a parking garage that is right near the port. This garage was one of the cheapest in the areas and they have parking exclusively for cruises. Also, the parking garage provides FREE shuttle to the port and back. Back to the hotel; we overall had a good stay at this Hilton; however, the side of the building we were on, which was the west side I believe had a outside window. Around 12:00 AM we woke up to loud noises outside and discovered there is a club next door to the hotel. A fight broke out and people were running everywhere. We really were not upset about the noise, because the club finally closed, but it could definitely become a problem for some. Look out for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mso3j
Reviews.Content: Last minute decision to visit New Orleans for family vacation. Did a lot of research for a hotel with close proximity to French Quarter, fridge in the room and free wi-fi. Valet parking cost was on par with the rest of the city, but was real excited about the wi-fi and fridge. Everything went smoothly, all staff was welcoming, especially the valets. Wireless internet was fast, fridge was cold and room was spotless. Only downside is distance from French Quarter. While most of the family did not mind the walk, the two 60+ in the group were not that thrilled (granted it was also 95+ and humid). Ended up just driving and parking in a lot instead of riding the street car because for the six of us it cost just a few dollars extra by the time you calculate the fare round trip for the street car. To be fair, this hotel is not aimed at French Quarter visitors, so the distance cannot really be considered in the rating. So overall, 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kalenawald
Reviews.Content: My friend and I drove down from TX with our daughters for the 2011 Jr. Olympics Jump Rope Competition. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff and valets were over-the-top helpful and friendly, the location was SO convenient (we only had to walk one block in the heat and humidity, thank goodness!) . I hated having to pay $30 per day for parking, but alas, that's the nature of the whole city - and this hotel had the lowest daily parking rate of all the hotels I checked (and I checked a BUNCH). I also loved that the room had a micro-fridge and microwave oven in it - saved us lots of money on breakfast, lunch and snacks. I didn't swim, but my daughter thoroughly enjoyed the pool. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Thiago_Rio
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and amenities. Walking-distance to French Quarter. Excellent prices for a Hilton hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: retired080
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet is $13 a person, go out the front door and walk straight half a block to the convention center. We had tea and oatmeal at Starbucks for $5. Added to that we were surrounded by local art in a clean and VERY spacious environment. Eat lunch and supper at the Riverwalk mall. It is a mall like you have never seen before, very reasonable food. It is a LONG walk to the French Quarter, especially in the heat. That is the only drawback to this hotel. Mandatory valet parking comes to $42 a day but your car is extremely safe, worth it. The staff at this hotel is amazing. Do not miss Cafe du Monde in the French Quarter for beignets and coffee, it is THE place in town to get them. Oceana is a great restaurant off Bourbon St. and the concierge gave us discount tickets. Also do not miss a performance at the Preservation Hall. We too the Grayline Katrina tour and it was fascinating. The arts district is fantastic, especially the Blue Dog gallery. If you like to shop for art and eat this is the city for both. The beds in this hotel are wonderful, you just want to sleep forever.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed everything and will certainly use them again.”
Reviews.Author: nanasp5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Convention Center area of the Warehouse district and is only one block from Convention Center. We were there to visit the WWII Museum and it was only a couple of blocks away and very easy to walk. The staff was exceptional and the breakfast buffet was FABULOUS. I

Reviews.Title: “Car Stolen by hotel employee...nothing getting done!!”
Reviews.Author: Klynn1107
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my wedding weekend in May 2011. We got married on a cruise ship before it sailed, then went on a 7 day cruise for our honeymoon. We used the hotels "cruise package" parking, the valet was very friendly, eager to help unload car etc... To make a long story short, we returned from our honeymoon to find that an employee STOLE my car. My car was used the entire week we were gone and over 500 miles put on my 2010 camry. My wedding dress, guest book, flowers and other personal stuff was put in back in my car after the wedding so it didn't get messed up on the cruise. The theif smoked in my car, spilled stuff, left cigarette butts in the back seat and then covered it with my wedding dress!! The smell of stale cigarettes and beer was horrible!! The front grill was knocked out, underneath my car is all beat up, several scratches, a dent in my door and left me having to get a wheel alignment. Securtiy cameras in the hotel parking garage proved that my car WAS used without my authorization, and it has now been 2 months and nothing has been done. A claim was sent to the hotels insurance company however when submitted it didn't go through. It was then stated that the hotel didn't have that type of coverage and would now have to be sent to valet. But that hasn't been done, the phone numbers I was given for the valet on my report and by the hotel are no longer in service. The hotels GM doesn't return phone calls, I get stuck talking to his assistant who is no help at all and seems to think this is no big deal. Instead of treating me as if I were the criminal everytime I call, try fixing the problem!!! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! It doesn't matter how clean, or how many renovations are done. If the people in management don't have a problem giving me the runaround and an employee is capable of using a customers car an entire week. There is no telling what kind of employee comes into your room when no one is looking!! Just saying......BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: mrseva
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up for Valet Parking, until the time we checked out, the Hilton Garden Inn New Orleans Convention Center exceeded all our expectations. The staff were the friendliest and most accomodating I've ever experienced. The valet guys - Reginald, Renaja, and Desmond were so awesome, helping get items out of our car and even helping us with a cab to the Superdome. Our party ended up being fewer than what we made reservations for, and the front desk reduced our rate, which covered most of our parking fees. Me and my 17-year old daughter were there for the 2011 Essence Music Festival over the July 4th weekend, and we both were highly impressed with the hotel. Our room was nice, spacious, and clean. Whenever we came back from our day's excursions, the bed was nicely made, fresh towels were put out, and the room tidied up. We also really enjoyed the rooftop pool! The hotel was in the perfect location from the Convention Center, a mere 1-block walk. We will definitely be staying here for the upcoming festivals, and I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who needs to be close to the Convention Center! Thanks everyone at HGINOCC! You all were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for convention center activities”
Reviews.Author: stweaver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the Convention Center, about 5 minutes walking if that. Not only that, it is small enough that you can have more personal service than the huge convention hotels. Room was comfortable and clean, people were friendly and helpful, and the elevators were fast. Breakfast was fast and pretty good, but a little pricey. Check-in and check-out was easy, no problems. They have ice water and lemonade throughout the day, and fresh cookies and apples available at the front desk. Don't expect a room with a view, though. May be too far to walk to French Quarter for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: merrills
Reviews.Content: More reasonable in price than nearby hotels. They let me check in early.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: hkk75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for a couple of nights and noticed that, despite that the hotel was literaly packed up with people, the receptionists were very friendly and helpfull and gave great suggestions for restaurants and shopping places. And the breakfast was quite good... I would gladly recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: beetle32637
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility from 6/5/2011 to 6/9/2011. From the time we arrived to the time we left the staff was more than accomadating. Everyone was very friendly and competant. the only flaw was a noise that appeared to come from the floors above us that sounded like laundry carts being rolled around. Annoying but not too bad. The restaurant was excellant, the quality of the food was excellant, and the price was as appropriate for the type of hotel . We would definitly satay there again if we go back to New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulR21212
Reviews.Content: I gad to go to New Orleans to help an old friend whose wife is gravely ill. The trip was arranged in a hurry and since I have Hilton Honors, I looked for an affiliated hotel that was reasonable and selected the Hilton Garden In at the Convention Center, The room was very nice and the free WiFi was very helpful. But what impressed me the most was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. From the desk personnel to the wait staff and the cleaning people, they were nice, friendly and seemed to really like their work and their guests. My only complaint was how expensive valet parking was. So, if you don't need a car and your stay in New Orleans calls for a hotel near the Convention Center, I heartily recommend the Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Insects in the food”
Reviews.Author: stern94
Reviews.Content: My experience was very good until I got a fly in my salad! =( Unacceptable.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: jmcfarland76
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying that we got a great deal on this hotel via a certain discount website... the one where they don't tell you the name of the hotel until you book it. The hotel is located very close to the convention center, so if you're in town for a convention, this is your spot. Front Desk is friendly, beds comfy, rooms clean. The swimming pool is located on the 4th floor, and while small, our kids still loved it. I did not give this an excellent rating because they want $28 a night for parking, which is par for a city, but I'm rather "frugal", so I tend to find alternatives. Metered parking on the street is free from 6pm Friday till around 8am Monday. We were able to park about 50 ft from the front door of this hotel, at a meter, for free. On a side note, when I asked the front desk for a family friendly place to eat with in walking distance, the directed us to Mulates. We were not impressed, in fact we ate our appetizer and left, only to eat at the restaurant in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice when attending a convention”
Reviews.Author: Munro1954
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the Convention Center. This is a excellent choice. Just a couple blocks from the convention center and well located to visit the WWII museum and restaurants like Commander's Palace and Emril's Delmonico. The Rooms are fine the service attentive. The perfect choice for attending conventions and just a short taxi ride from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Could not wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: valene444
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised that Hilton would put their name on this hotel. It is extremely old and dated. Our bathtub was badly chipped and had been painted over, the door frame and tub drain were rusted. The shower curtain was stained. The carpet was old and disgusting--wouldn't dare step barefoot on any part of it. A friend staying in another room turned the tap on at the bathroom sink and a black oily sludge poured out! The outdoor courtyard area and pool was closed for repair with no notice given when the hotel room was booked or at check in. When we notified the front desk that we were moving to another hotel, the staff gave us a difficult time and threatened to charge us a cancellation fee even though we were giving them 48 hours notice! We were so happy to leave and check in to a beautiful hotel for $1.00 more per night! I had read the Trip Advisor reviews, and I knew the hotel was not going to be top-notch, but it was pre-booked for us. The only positive comment is that the location did have good access to the conference centre. I definitely do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too loud to sleep”
Reviews.Author: tallyman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice during jazzfest. Good rates, great location, nice hotel, but the noise means I'll never stay here again. We were on the river side, top floor, and the warehouse across the street was rented out for a party/concert that kept us up till past 3 am. When I mentioned this at the desk, they were surprised, and said that we were on the quiet side of the hotel. The other side has noise from a club every night, but the river side only has it during special events. Not much comfort when you're there during the special event.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: alwayssneezy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend an event at the convention center. Location was great for the CC and only a short walk was necessary to pick-up the St. Charles street car. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The onsite restaurant was good - simple - and the hotel also had a pantry to select food and beverages from. (I picked-up breakfast cereal here fairly cheap). All in all, a great value for a low price. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lovjoh
Reviews.Content: Right from the start you are required to pay $28 just to park. I was never informed of this when the reservation was made. There was linens all over the hall, had to push them out of the way just to get to the room. The room was a non smoking room and smelt like a dirty ashtray. The beds were beyond wore out. This place needs updated in a bad way. I've stayed in way better for less.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lata016
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location to the Port of New Orleans. We were going on a cruise and arrived the night before our ship was to leave and we wanted to be close to the port. We took the Airport Shuttle to the hotel which was a good value. Upon our arrival to the hotel we were warmly greeted by the front desk clerk. She gave us an overview of the amenities the hotel had to offer and she gave us directions to our room. We were in a room with a king sized bed and we felt the room was a good size. The bathroom had a decent hairdryer and included plenty of towels. We did not sleep well because the bed was really hard which we tried to adjust but it didn't work. We also couldn't sleep because of noise outside the hotel from the street below our room. I have read other comments and found that other customers had the same problems and that the hotel management has addressed the reviews by saying they were looking into a solution. We took a taxi to the French Quarter at night which cost about $10 each way. We walked several blocks back to the French Quarter the next morning to have beignets and to see the sights. Our cruise ship was not leaving until later in the day so we had the hotel store our luggage. Having that service was great as we didn't have to worry about our things while we spent some time sightseeing. I would recommend this hotel if you are planning a cruise out of New Orleans. The hotel is within walking distance to the port, but I would not walk. I would use a taxi instead. The signage was not great and we spent a lot of time walking around trying to find our way to the port. A taxi would have driven us right there.

Reviews.Title: “Across the Street From An Obnoxiously Loud Club”
Reviews.Author: baileylovetraveler
Reviews.Content: We actually just checked in tonight into a room on the 6th floor (even number side). The noise across the street from the club is absurd. I can't imagine how horrible it must be for guests on lower floors. I called downstairs to find out the noise usually goes on until 3am or 4am. Part of our choice of this hotel was for business - away from the French Quarter and all the noise. Fair warning to others - come with strong ear plugs and some sleeping pills. The room may be nice enough, but that doesn't count for anything unless they get soundproof windows.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle....”
Reviews.Author: gohounds19
Reviews.Content: A friend and I drove to New Orleans from Chicago to ring in the New year. Neither of us wanted to stay in the French Quarter, so we settled on the Hilton Garden Inn near the convention center. Great choice! The hotel is in a good location... it's about a three quarter mile to the French Quarter. Harrah's Casino and the Riverwalk are a few blocks away. It was nice to be able to escape to a quiet hotel for a good night's rest! The lobby was very clean and welcoming. Our room was spacious and seemed to be well kept. The bathroom was clean, but it could use some updating. The Hilton Garden Inn offered a great Fitness Center! We were lucky to have it right on our floor. One of the better Fitness Centers I've seen in a hotel setting. This helped keep us from feeling guilty about eating all the delicious cuisine New Orleans has to offer! Although we did not take advantage of the hotel's restaurant or small convenience shop, it was an added bonus to have these on-site. The only downsides to the hotel was the valet parking was a bit pricey (however, the valet attendants were very friendly) and the room pay-per-view movies were highway robbery. All in all, this hotel was a great choice for our stay in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad bed”
Reviews.Author: PollyFinders
Reviews.Content: Following a bad experience with one of the new Hilton Garden Inn adjustable beds in October, I began checking the beds for leaks as soon as we checked in on a recent trip. After having no problems in several HGIs, except one that "wheezed" when we sat or moved around on it, I got careless and ended up with the same problem we'd had in a Tampa HGI a couple of months earlier. The mattress leaked and formed a depression when you sat or lay on it. Once again, it was about midnight when we made the discovery and we didn't feel like getting dressed and moving, so we decided to tough it out. The first time my husband agreed to sleep in the "trench" but this time I took the bad side. I probably spent more than half the night in the middle of the bed, which meant that the mattress space we shared was less than the area of a double. Uncomfortable night for both of us. The experience confirmed my suspicion that Hilton was probably sold a bill of goods with these mattresses. It seems to us that considering the problems many hotels have with keeping the air conditioning, shower heads, drains, lamps, etc., in working order, adding beds that require maintenance and repairs to the mix isn't so wise. The Tampa HGI with the leaking mattress refunded our night's stay, but this hotel seemed somewhat dismissive of the problem and mostly queried us on whether everything else was okay. (Though they did give us some extra points for the stay.) Since then I have read about other people who have had problems with "broken" adjustable beds (one amusingly describing the mattress as doing "a Mariana Trench impression"), so I'm afraid these mattresses are going to influence my HGI stay decisions greatly. Two defective out of seven adjustable beds, particularly considering that they're relatively new, doesn't bode well for the future. And having to immediately lie on the bed for the several minutes (they seem to deflate slowly, not instantly) upon entering the room is an aggravation we don't really need. Otherwise the hotel was fine. Clean and attractive lobby and rooms. Not as convenient to the Quarter as some, it's still walking distance (though a longer walk than some might like and not nearly as close as the Hilton we moved to the next night). Convenient to some fairly good restaurants. ("Fairly good" in New Orleans would be "great" in most other cities.) Rates were reasonable at this time of year. Their breakfast buffet was good (though can't say if it was a good value since we didn't pay for it and don't know what it cost). Just beware of the beds - all Hilton Garden Inn beds. So my recommendation comes with some reservation.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, WITH GREAT QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: WITHFAMILY04
Reviews.Content: Travelling with family ( 2 young kids/wife) - Hotel located in a quiet place. Family felt safe, 5 minutes away in car from French Qtrs - Parking is slighlty inconvenient. Valets are efficeint. - Lobby is clean but utiliarian. - Room had a good view to the garden diagnol to the hotel - Will stay again if going to New Orleans - Had taken the cruise package (charge 28 for first day and 10 $ for subsequent days).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Wonderful Location to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: RobertsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Convention Center in early Nov. It was 1 block to the convention center. Great location. Also within walking distance was a Hertz rent a car which we needed 1 day (great staff as well there). The best thing about the hotel was by far the staff! They were wonderful. Every single one that I encountered throughout the day and our stay greeting me/us - always! even the housekeeping staff - which are sometimes a bit shy. If one of the maintenance guys was near an elevator and saw us heading for it, they would push the elevator button to speed up the progess. On our 2nd morning, the young woman that was our waitress the day before, remembered that one of us took coffee and the other one had hot tea. And every morning after that it was the same friendly attention that may you feel like you had been there for years. The hotel is within a 15 - 20 min walk to the french quarter. and a short-taxi ride to the Garden district. The rooms and lobby was the usual Hilton Garden Inn variety. Clean and fairly up to date. Free Wifi as far as I can remember - for hotel guest. Even if we come back for a leisure trip, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Even Made it Past the Front Desk!!! (Bait & Switch)”
Reviews.Author: Kurt5280
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hilton Garden Inn with an internet â€œcruise packageâ€� reservation in hand and was greeted by a front desk employee that started changing my reservation and requesting additional fees for parkingâ€¦so in response I requested to be released from my reservation without penalty. Subsequently, I was properly greeted by the Front Desk Manager that explained the â€œcruise packageâ€� reservation to the front desk employeeâ€¦but also explained the parking for the â€œcruise packageâ€� was only valet so I would have to give my car keys to the hotel valet for a weekâ€¦not what I was previously told in a telephone conversation with the front desk when I contacted the hotel about the â€œcruise packageâ€� deal. (Note: The self parking facility at the Erato Street Cruise Terminal is in a US Customs and Border Control Security Zone and is a little more expensive but much safer that the valet parking at the Hilton Garden Inn.) I was subsequently released from my reservation without penalty and front desk employee apologized and explained that she was a new employee and did not understand the internet â€œcruise packageâ€� reservationâ€¦so I subsequently reserved at the French Quarter Holiday Inn which has the best parking in downtown New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A little far to the French Quarter unless you like to walk”
Reviews.Author: vacationlady1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before check in so they stored our luggage for us and told us they would call us when the room was ready. They did not call until close to 4. This hotel is a hike to the French Quarters unless you do not mind walking. I would not walk late at night in this area. Itâ€™s a good location for anyone taking a cruise or attending meetings in the convention center. If you walk through the riverwalk mall and walk to the very end, its about three blocks to the hotel. There is no free continental breakfast but it does have free wireless in the room. The room is a nice size with a wide range of channels on the tv. The tv needs to be updated as it as the old style tv. The bed was comfortable and the drapes blocked out the light. Plenty of towels and large counter space in the bathroom. There is a mini refrigerator in the room. Typical Hilton hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient hotel to convention center”
Reviews.Author: coopmommy
Reviews.Content: The location was great as the hotel is only 1 block from the convention center and as a conference exhibitor, I was carrying alot back and forth each day. The staff is friendly, taxis are readily available and the hotel was clean and had a nice lobby. The free wifi in the room worked great too and the bed was comfortable. My only negative is that at night, I would not have been comfortable walking in a 2 block radius around the hotel as it was very deserted and didn't feel safe. I was able to find someone from my company to walk me back to the hotel at night, but as a woman, I would have not wanted to walk those last 2 blocks alone. Once you're on Convention Way, it's busy and feels safe. It's about 5-6 blocks to the riverwalk and the hilton riverside, Harrah's hotel and casino etc where there's more restaurants. I didn't see many restaurants right near the Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel - Convenient, clean, and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: raoulduck
Reviews.Content: They accommodated me on short notice after my reservation at the Canal St. Marriott wasn't honored. Their desk staff is professional and first rate. The king suite was huge and not overpriced. High standard of cleanliness throughout the room and hotel. Away from the madness of Bourbon and Canal Street, but close to the great restaurants and clubs of the Warehouse District and Riverwalk. It's location one block from the Convention Center was ideal for me. The fresh cooked breakfast is a great way to start a day of business.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, recommended overall”
Reviews.Author: Voost
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place overall and I'd recommend it with a few caveats. First, our shower head was taped with electrical tape to the shower pipe- weird. Also one of the ladies at the front desk didn't seem to be too clued into customer service when she didn't allow us to put a rollaway bed in our room after we had already confirmed it online. Overall though, service at this place is friendly and helpful and the location is great. This is a good place to stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gjec
Reviews.Content: We are so happy that we stayed at this hotel over other hotels that are closer to the French Quarter. Because our interests were New Orleans cuisine and culture rather than partying, we were thankful that we can get sound sleep after a long day of walking around the city! We also preferred the walk, which is really not bad at all if you are a walker, because after all the yummy food of New Orleans, you can use all the exercise you can get!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BJHarroun
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in. Hotel has an elegant lobby. My impression was that the hotel is very attractive. Everything appears very clean and well cared-for. We had a standard king room. The bed was luxurious. The hotel offered a nice breakfast buffet, but it was not complimentary. Even made to order omelets were included. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning. The outdoor pool is quite small and the whirlpool was not heated the morning we used it. The biggest downside is the expensive parking, but this is an area-wide problem. If there is an alternative to $25 parking we did not find it. Don't forget that they get city and state sales tax on the parking also.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: talemah
Reviews.Content: Hotel was decent but is aging badly. The wood accents have all been chipped or broken. Found hair everywhere in the room and stains on the accent pillow. Other than that the staff was very nice and it was a very short walk to the convention center which was a plus. This is not a hotel to stay at if you are wanting to go to the french market or bourbon street as it is a very long walk. If you are staying on the weekend make sure you do not get a room on the side where the club called Generation Hall is.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Kaymarie24
Reviews.Content: You will feel welcomed the moment you step into this hotel. The staff is very very courteous and accomodating. The location is a short walk to the convention center. We were attending an exhibit at the convention center which made it the perfect location. The room was very clean. We had breakfast at the hotel which was quite good. An overall great hotel experience.....and a big round of applause to the wonderful staff....especially Sharon and Emanuel! Great job!

Reviews.Title: “I'm not here for the party. I want to sleep. My windows are rattling from the subwoofer party.”
Reviews.Author: raytubes
Reviews.Content: Review from Diamond member , 33 stays this year. Good, Entry, Lobby, Restaurant all looks HGI std and fresh. -Cocon Butcher around the corner. http://www.cochonbutcher.com/ -Comfort control bed (controls are hidden in top corner side of bed) Bad: Curbisde checkin/valet parking was 100% full, double parked in the street. I couldn't park, so I illegally parked, checked in, then double parked, and jumped out and made sure a valet got in my car right away, to get it off the street pronto. -I tried a cookie from the free bin, it was a fancy oatmeal/cranberry cookie, however, one bite and into the trash it went. Nobody ate those cookies yesterday, they aren't gonna eat them today! -Dissappointed to find two tube TV's in my suites. I really had expected LCDs. At least analog TV changes channels faster. -There is a hall/venue out the west / back end of the hotel. It's rented out tonight, street security showed up about 8pm. It was no street party, but tonight, it is a warm up show for the essence festival. there's a hip hop/soul/rap show booming across the allley from my room. It's almost 3am. Front desk says maybe til 4 or 5 am... Hotel is 100% booked.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: bayman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention .It is 1 block to the convention center -very convenient.There are a few restaurants in the area(Emeril's ,Mulate's).Our room was very quiet even though we were at the elevators.Staff was polite but not overly solicitious .Tried to get change at the desk ,but was told that the desk clerks don't have cash .The room was clean ,but not spotless.Room was not big ,but not tiny.Overall ,it was just fine It is a hefty walk to the Quarter ,and even further to Marigny.We walked to the Quarter ,but late at night hopped a cab back to the hotel -it's about a $10 dollar ride .You can ride the streetcar for $1.25 ,but it is very slow and stops running at 10pm. If you are attending meetings at the convention center it would be a good place to stay ,but if you are looking to party you would be better off staying in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend with my dad and if i could do it over would get a different hotel.”
Reviews.Author: valid908
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel wasn't terrible and I'm sure there are worse hotels in the Big Easy. However, it was a disappointment due to the location being too far from Bourbon street and the nightlife. It was in June and very humid already so cabs were a must especially since my dad is older and couldn't walk far in the sweltering heat. The restaurant downstairs is so-so and expensive. We ate there the 1st night but i wouldn't recommend it. The hotel room was basic with no frills. The bathroom had no ventilation fan or window which I'm surprised other travelers haven't mentioned and my feet would get wet due to the condensation getting on the carpet next to the bathroom. We ended up switching rooms after the 1st day because they put us next to a very loud mother and her screaming child. Also the toilet seat was broken and it was somewhat dirty. In general, the rooms are not super clean and the 1st room also smelled like smoke even though it was non-smoking. On the plus side, the downstairs desk attendants were helpful and nice. The Internet room that they have for free Internet access was nice too if you don't take a computer with you traveling and there were plenty of available computers. Overall, I would not stay here again due to the location and the lack of upkeep in the rooms plus you could hear your neighbor cough and do whatever else in the next room-

Reviews.Title: “Wortst Sleep Ever”
Reviews.Author: bschless
Reviews.Content: What they don't tell you is that on Sunday and Wednesday nights (and some otheres when someone rents the alley) there is a party right outside the hotel that goes until 5 or 6 am. Had a convention here and the sleep from hell. The people in the hotel were very friendly, but ask the desk clerk for a room that will be quiet when any parties are going to be held next door. One of the bellmen doubles working the parties, so ask...you'll be sad if you don't

Reviews.Title: “Extremely fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: jovt
Reviews.Content: The entire staff of this hotel were wonderful, friendly, courteous, professional, helpful, always with a smile. The bellman, Ronelle (not sure the spelling) helped us through a very stressful experience with the shuttle, going above and beyond to help us. The room was great, very comfortable, and we highly recommend a stay here. It is a brief walk to the Convention Center, and comfortable walking distance to Bourbon Street, Harrah's, French Quarter, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention center, average serive”
Reviews.Author: mad.nomad
Reviews.Content: Very close to Ernest Morial convention center. Good sixzed rooms, 4th floor outdoor swimming pool, free coffee and cookies in the evening, some decent restaurants nearby but away from Borboun and Frenchmen. Not sure if I would recommend walking back from there at night. Room service and daily cleaning and replenishing of coffee and toiletries very perfunctory. Don't expect too much there. On the whole, will stay there again, but for the price of around $250++ per night, there are better options on Poydras unless you were forced to go farther away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dottiecoit
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were allowed to check-in. Registration clerk immediately checked our bags into a holding room. While sitting & waiting, we were then approached by a clerk to visit the hospitality room which was embellished with a small delicious buffet of pasta topped with fresh lump crab meat & shrimp, fresh fruit, crackers and cheeses, and the best freshly squeeze lemonade we ever had. Clerks and bellmen were extremely kind, helpful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good customer-service”
Reviews.Author: crackerdoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a medical convention. The location is excellent, near the Convention Center, National D-Day Museum, Harrah's Casino, and a short taxi-ride or 20 minute walk to the French Quarter. Rooms are spacious and clean, staff is friendly. Great customer-service, nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Wonderful.... Stafff Could Use a Branding Class.....”
Reviews.Author: msim42
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say I received a really great rate for this hotel on Hotwire, which may be the root of my problem. On check in, I was registered by an aloof female, bordering on rude, and I kept waiting for her to roll her eyes whenever I said anything, but she was able to control herself - barely, so it seems. The rooms are fantasic - fridge, microwave, free wireless, large and clean. Room Service is extremely expensive, slow, and the order was inaccurate, but we eventually got it straight after a few trips. Again, when calling to inquire about our hour late dinner, I encountered a very hostile female over the phone - "We are very busy now!!" Didn't care that I had some hungry children. Over an hour is way too long to wait, especially since we ordered early and they were not busy when we ordered. One word of caution though, the menus in the rooms must be old, the prices were more expensive (few dollars per entree) and they "no longer served" several items on the menu. I would return again if I got a good rate, because the rooms are fine, and the hotel is very well kept - I just appreciate good manners and professionalism, which I did not find here 50-60% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant place to stay for a New Orleans convention”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: After a year of staying in hotels (50, I think), this hotel was a pleasant surprise. Staff at the front desk were pleasant, prompt and helpful. The hotel is clean and modern, and has good facilities. It is only a block away from the Convention Center. Rooms are large, clean and much quieter than where I have stayed in New Orleans before. Room service was of good quality, if a little slow on one busy night. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are in New Orleans for a convention. Yes, it is some distance to the French Quarter - but at night most people will want to catch a taxi anyway.

Reviews.Title: “It IS close to the Convention Center....”
Reviews.Author: Catsmeow3
